content.description: Relatively easy slab climb, with committing moves up high.
content.location: Level two, on the south face of the Bazooka Joe boulder. Go right up the middle of the "V" formation

climbs.name: The Thing That Only Eats Hippies

content.description: Start low on the right, traverse the lip and top out.
content.location: Cave north of the quarry proper.

content.description: Easy but committing slab climb, very comparable to its neighbor, Vendetta.
content.protection: Stacked pads. Talus at the landing.
content.location: On the Bazooka Joe block, right of vendetta

content.description: A good rail traverse with a slightly freaky landing. Nothing too spicy.
content.location: Large diagonal block at the top of the quarry. Sit start the left side of the south face, gain the rail and traverse right.

content.description: This is a cool sloper problem to the right of Long Black Cadillac. It follows the left-leaning outside corner. Don't use the crack or anything right of it.
content.protection: at least two pads, and someone to keep you out of the tree.
content.location: Second level, Long Black Cadillac block

content.description:
This problem and its neighbor, Cool Ranch, are pretty common warmups for the sector.

Not Cho Cheese follows a series of sloping crimps on a low angled slab. The rail is off; remain on the face.
content.location: Level one, prominent triangular boulder left of Jack in the Crack.

content.description: Standing start on Campus board crimps. Good holds close together. Really fun
content.location: First level, all the way right. Look for the flaring chimney. Lumber Jack and Lumber Jill are both on the right face of this dihedral.

content.description: Sit start to the right, traverse up and left along campus board crimps. Crux down low.
content.location: First level, far right. Look for the flaring chimney. Lumber Jack is on the right side of this dihedral.

content.description: Big moves on miniscule holds. Jump start to a prominent 2-finger pocket.
Awesome dihedral crack. Easy but the crux is up high.
content.protection: Itâ€™s pretty tall. Use several pads and attentive spotters.
content.location: Lowest level, towards the center of the quarry formation.

content.description:
Difficult one or two move problem. Most people dyno from the start to the lip, but the right variation is fairly static. The obvious start hold is a shallow mono; it will be your right hand if you choose the dyno, or your left if you do the right variant.

Standing start.
content.location: the furthest block to the left, just below The Only Thing That Eats Hippies. South face, near the southwest corner

content.description: Big moves on a blank slab. Inspiring and unsettling!
content.protection: One pad is sufficient, but watch out for the uneven landing to the right.

content.description:
Easy moves down low lead to a couple of long crimp pulls up high.

As to the name, the first ascent was done sans pads, and the name Hot Lava was already taken.
content.location: second level, near the middle of the quarry.

content.description:
Super easy ledges and edges up to a couple thin crux moves at the very top.

Easy to bail onto platform to your right if you don't want to pull final moves. If you pop off on the crux moves, you might break your back on the giant knife blade boulder pointing straight at you.

It's also very easy to break off the tiny nubs and edges used at the top. Tread lightly.
content.protection: Have multiple spotters and pads to keep you from the death-boulder.
content.location: Second level. Obvious blunt arete two aretes to the right of Long Black Cadillac.

content.description: Sit start the right corner rail of the dorito formation. Lieback to the apex and top out.
content.location: First level, Dorito formation. Right of Not Cho Cheese.

content.description:
This is a short vertical problem on very small pockets.

sit start with the left hand in a sidepull, pull up through monos and shallow "1st team" pockets. Look for crappy feet and top out.
content.protection: one pad to keep your shoes clean
content.location: This is the hard part; it's not actually in the quarry. If you're at heebie jeebies, look directly across the gravel gully and you'll see a fire ring with a bale of wire in it. the boulder is about 10 feet to the left.

content.description: Fun slabby corner. Pretty tall. Standing start.
content.location: First Level, left of Jack in the Crack

content.protection: Stacked pads and a good spotter. The landing isn't the worst, but you'll want a buddy who pays attention.
content.location: second level, above and just left of Jack in the Crack
